215.title: Requiring licensees authorized to serve alcoholic liquors or nonintoxicating beer to have certain liability insurance coverage
215.description: The purpose of this bill is to require licensees authorized to serve alcoholic liquors or nonintoxicating beer to have certain liability insurance coverage to cover the premises of the licensee. The bill establishes a statutory minimum level of insurance coverage. The bill directs the Alcoholic Beverage Control Commissioner, upon a finding that either statutory minimum insurance coverage is inadequate, to increase statutory minimum coverage amounts by legislative rule.

216.title: Providing school days to register and transport students to vote
216.description: The purpose of this bill is to require county boards of education to provide days prior to early voting during primary, general and special elections for registering eligible students to vote and for the transportation of registered students to appropriate voting places during early voting periods.

217.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
217.title: Requiring county school boards to provide adequate mental health and counseling services
217.description: The purpose of this bill is to require county school boards to provide adequate mental health and counseling services in the form of the employment of a psychologist or psychiatrist to pupils to address issues stemming from drug abuse.

218.title: Licensing the practice of athletic training
218.description: The purpose of this bill is to license the practice of athletic training and provide criminal penalties.

219.title: Exempting social security benefits from personal income tax
219.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt social security benefits from personal income tax.

220.last_action: To House Fire Departments and Emergency Medical Services
220.title: Exempting firefighters and volunteer firefighters from payment of income and real and personal property taxes
220.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt firefighters, who are full-time employees of a local fire department, and volunteer firefighters who have successfully completed training requirements under §29-3-6 of this code and who are employed by a volunteer fire department, from payment of income and real and personal property taxes.

221.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
221.title: Providing an increase in compensation for natural resources police officers
221.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an increase in compensation for natural resources police officers.

222.title: Exempting persons with valid religious objections from having their photographs taken and placed on government licenses
222.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt a person with a valid religious objection from the requirement that his or her picture be taken and placed on a driver’s license or other identification card authorized or required under any provision of the code.

223.title: Clarifying that a vehicle may not be backed into a public street or highway unless it does not interfere with other traffic
223.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that a vehicle may not be backed into a public street or highway unless it does not interfere with other traffic.

224.title: Including family court judges in the Judges’ Retirement System
224.description: The purpose of this bill is to include family court judges in the Judges’ Retirement System.

225.title: Relating to the authorization to release a defendant or a person arrested upon his or her own recognizance
225.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify misdemeanor bail requirements. The bill requires a court or magistrate to release a person charged with certainÂ misdemeanor offenses on his or her own recognizance except for good cause shown. The bill also sets forth exceptions when a person may not be released on his or her own recognizance.Â Â

226.title: Defining a work day for school service personnel and removing a provision relating to employment of licensed practical nurses
226.description: The purpose of this bill is to define work day and half work day for school service personnel.

227.title: Giving local authorities the authority to decrease the speed limit on streets and highways where school buses travel in its jurisdiction
227.description: The purpose of this bill is to give local authorities the authority to decrease the speed limit on streets and highways where school buses travel.Â The bill provides that no lowering of a speed limit is effective until approved by the Commissioner of Highways.

228.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
228.title: Paying a monthly allotment to certain veterans
228.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the establishment of a program to pay a monthly allotment check to certain veterans.

229.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
229.title: Creating a state administered wholesale drug importation program
229.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the state to designate a state agency to become a drug wholesaler to import pharmaceuticals from Canada to provide cheaper drugs to West Virginians.

230.title: Creating the Vehicle Registration Scofflaw Elimination Program
230.description: The purpose of this bill is to create under the purview of the State Police the Vehicle Registration Scofflaw Elimination Program to help identify state residents who have failed to register their vehicles with the Division of Motor Vehicles.

231.title: Prohibiting forcing currently owner-occupied residences to be required to participate in a public sewer or public water system
231.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit any state public utility from forcing owner-occupied residences to participate in a public residential sewer system except where the sewer system being used is unsafe for human use or is a clear public safety hazard to others.

232.title: Relating to eligibility in the Public Employees Retirement System for those newly elected or appointed members of the State Legislature
232.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a person newly elected or appointed as a member of the State Legislature after 2020 will not be eligible for pension benefits based on legislative service.

233.title: Electing members of county school boards on a nonpartisan basis in general elections
233.description: The purpose of this bill is to elect members of county school boards on a nonpartisan basis and only in general elections. The bill provides that members elected in primary elections shall continue on the boards until any new members take office. The bill repeals §3-5-6.

234.last_action: Motion house reconsider its action rejected (Roll No. 62)
234.title: Modifying the school calendar to begin not earlier than September 1 and end no later than June 7
234.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the school instructional calendar to begin not earlier than Labor Day and end prior to Memorial Day.

235.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
235.title: Relating generally to survivor benefits for emergency response providers
235.description: The purpose of this bill is to include Division of Forestry employees eligible for survivor benefits as other first responders if they are killed while engaging in wildland fire fighting. This an Interim Committee bill recommended for introduction and passage by the Forest Management Review Commission.

236.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
236.title: Increasing compensation for conservation officers
236.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an increase in compensation for conservation officers.

237.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
237.title: Granting the West Virginia Board of Examiners for Registered Professional Nurses the sole authority for the accreditation of nursing schools
237.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant the West Virginia Board of Examiners for Registered Professional Nurses the sole authority for the accreditation of nursing schools. The bill reverts the code provision on nursing school accreditation back to what it was before being amended during the 2018 Legislative Session.

238.title: Prosecuting Attorney’s Detectives Act
238.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Prosecuting Attorney’s Detectives Act.

239.title: Creating the Independent Redistricting Commission of the Joint Committee on Government and Finance
239.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the Redistricting Office of the Joint Committee on Government and Finance to propose redistricting plans during census years. The main task of the Redistricting Office is to propose a plan to the Legislature which is based on constitutional and legal requirements and considerations.Â The bill provides specific criteria that the redistricting office must observe in proposing district mappings. The bill requires the redistricting office to advertise a proposed draft map of districts to the public. The bill requires the redistricting office to recommend redistricting plan to the Legislature. The bill requires the full Legislature to vote on plan ratification. The bill provides for subsequent submissions of plans and vote by Legislature. The bill requires that the commission certify to the Secretary of State that its final proposal for district boundaries is in accordance with constitutional and legal requirements. The bill prohibits certain persons from influencing or attempting to influence district mapping proposals of the redistricting office.

240.title: Exempting certain kindergartens, preschools and school education programs that are operated by a private school from state licensure requirements
240.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt kindergartens, preschools and school education programs that are operated by a private school whose accreditation includes its preschool classes and is recognized by the state Department of Education under Policy 2330 from state licensure requirements.

241.title: Middle School Technical Education Program Act
241.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide information to high school students regarding career and technical educational opportunities during and after high school, to create a career and technical education for middle school students, and to codify the Governor’s Workforce Credential.

242.title: Relating to eligibility for parole
242.description: The purpose of this bill is to make all convicts eligible to petition for parole when their good time credits and actual time served equal 30 years.

243.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
243.title: Allowing low income senior citizens to receive certain tax credits without filing a state income tax return
243.description: The purpose of this bill is to simplify the manner in which a low income senior citizen may claim certain tax credits.

244.title: Redirecting excise tax revenue on bottled soft drinks from West Virginia University schools to the Public Employees Insurance Agency
244.description: The purpose of this bill is to redirect excise tax revenue on bottled soft drinks from certain West Virginia University schools to the Public Employees Insurance Agency.

245.title: Relating to the definition of a political party for all state and local elections
245.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the definition of a political party for all state and local elections by providing official ballot status to a political party that has received at least one percent of the votes in the preceding general election for a statewide office or has at least 5,000 voters registered as members. The bill also makes the definition applicable to municipalities.

246.title: Educational Equality Act
246.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Educational Equality Act. The bill authorizes a $500 tax credit per child for parents and legal guardians whose children attend a nonpublic school. The bill prohibits the creation of additional regulations over the education of a child whose parent or legal guardian receives the tax credit. The bill authorizes rulemaking.

247.title: Providing that West Virginia will not participate in the REAL ID Act of 2005
247.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that West Virginia will not participate in the REAL ID Act of 2005 enacted by the United States Congress in Public Law 109-13.

248.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
248.title: Creating a statutory right to petition circuit and family courts for sibling visitation
248.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a statutory right for siblings to petition a circuit or family court for visitation with their minor child siblings.

249.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
249.title: Relating to cruelty to animals
249.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the statute relating to cruelty to animals.Â The bill provides definitions of “food”, “water”, “shelter” and “treatment”.Â It provides specifics for tethering an animal.Â The bill includes for seizure of an animal for violations in addition to increasing criminal penalties.Â Finally, the bill provides that a person in violation of this statute for a second time shall be added to a state-wide, publicly available, do not adopt or sell registry.

250.title: Increasing the minimum wage based upon increases in the consumer price index
250.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the minimum wage based upon increases in the consumer price index.

251.title: Requiring free feminine hygiene products in grades 6 through 12
251.description: The purpose of this bill is to require county boards of education to provide free feminine hygiene products in grades six through 12.

252.title: Providing an exemption from regulation by the Public Service Commission for motor vehicles used exclusively in the transportation of roll-off solid waste containers
252.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt motor carriers of "roll-off containers" from regulation by the Public Service Commission. It also requires the Public Service Commission to propose rules for legislative approval to implement the amended provisions of this section.

253.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
253.title: Department of Agriculture Capital Improvements Fund
253.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a new special revenue fund and a funding source to support the Department of Agriculture’s efforts to make capital improvements to its facilities.

254.title: Increasing criminal penalties for impersonation of law-enforcement officers or officials
254.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase criminal penalties for impersonation of law- enforcement officers or officials.

255.title: Prohibiting the private ownership or operation of a prison
255.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the private ownership or operation of prison facilities in West Virginia.

256.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
256.title: Establishing different rates of taxation for tobacco products for certain border counties
256.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide different tobacco products tax rates in certain counties of the state.

257.title: Modifying the Fair Trade Practices Act
257.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the Fair Trade Practices Act with regard to costs and damages.

258.title: Pothole app and map
258.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Commissioner of Highways to develop an app and a map that permits individuals to report, and keep track of, potholes on the roads and streets of the state.

259.title: Relating to the theft of consumer identity protections
259.description: The purpose of this bill is to include protection for theft of identity information of persons 60 years of age or older or individuals under 18 years of age.Â The bill; adds definitions; provides that a report to law-enforcement agency that a person’s identifying information has been lost or stolen is prima facie evidence of identity theft.Â And the bill provides both misdemeanor and felony penalties for violations.

260.title: Relating to the removal of the severance tax on oil and gas produced from low producing oil and natural gas wells
260.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the severance tax on oil and gas produced from low producing wells.

261.title: Providing certain employees of the Highways increases in annual pay
261.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide regional field employees of the Division of Highways increases in annual pay.

262.title: Relating to the ineligibility for home incarceration for offenders under certain circumstances
262.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the sentence of home incarceration unavailable to an offender convicted of two or more unrelated felony offenses, not arising from the same criminal transaction on a prior occasion in this jurisdiction or any jurisdiction within the United States.

263.title: Authorizing certain West Virginia courthouse security officers to carry concealed firearms
263.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize certain West Virginia courthouse security officers to carry concealed firearms; authorize arrest powers to courthouse security officers under certain circumstances; prescribe requirements for permission to carry concealed firearms; and the legislative intent.

264.title: Shifting funding from the Landfill Closure Assistance Fund to local solid waste authorities
264.description: The purpose of this bill is to shift funding from the Landfill Closure Assistance Fund, which was set up in 1991 to properly close old landfills across the state, to local solid waste authorities.Â According to the 2017 West Virginia Solid Waste Management Plan, 28 of the 35 old landfills have been properly remediated by the fund.Â Given the progress made towards closure of the old landfills, the portion of the solid waste fee assessed on landfill deposits, which is currently sent to the fund, is being reduced in order to accommodate an in-kind increase in the portion of the solid waste fee charged by county or regional solid waste authorities to fund various recycling, litter control, and other locally important solid waste programs.Â Additionally, this bill would allow for a reduction in the use of county commission/county tax dollars currently used to support various recycling, litter control, and other locally important solid waste programs.

265.title: Relating to the whistle-blower law
265.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend or clarify protections under the state’s whistle-blower law.

266.title: Prohibiting registered sex offenders from participating in Halloween activities
266.description: The purpose of this to prohibit registered sex offenders from participating in Halloween activities. The bill requires certain signage and establishes criminal penalties.

267.title: Relating to the ineligibility for probation of certain defendants
267.description: The purpose of this bill is to deny probation to a criminal defendant previously convicted of two or more prior, unrelated felonies.

268.title: Relating to certain defendants ineligible for probation
268.description: The purpose of this bill is to make certain defendants who have been convicted of two or more prior unrelated felonies not a part of the same criminal transaction ineligible for probation. The bill also establishes a procedure.

269.title: Authorizing the Department of Motor Vehicles to issue certain vital records in the custody of the State Registrar
269.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide the authority to the Commissioner of the Division of Motor Vehicles to issue certain vital records subject to the rules and regulations of the State Registrar, to allow the DMV to collect fees for issuing vital records that will be provided to the State Registrar, and for the Commissioners of the DMV and DHHR to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding to implement a program that allows the DHHR to provide access to certain vital records to the DMV.

270.title: Permitting salary increases for full time official court reporters based upon years of service
270.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit salary increases for full time official court reporters based upon years of service.

271.title: The Campus Self Defense Act
271.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a person who holds a current and valid license to carry a concealed deadly weapon to carry such a weapon on the campus and in the buildings of a state institution of higher education. It provides exceptions and immunity to an institution for a licensee’s intentional or unintentional use of a firearm while carrying it under the act.  The bill seeks to acknowledge that violence against disarmed law-abiding citizens is an increasing, but unnecessary, occurrence. The bill is an attempt by the Legislature to reaffirm a law-abiding citizen's Second Amendment Right, the right to protect themselves by allowing legally licensed and permitted employees, staff, and students of public universities the right to legally carry a concealed weapon within specified limitations.

272.title: Relating to the Antihazing Law
272.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the definition of hazing to address any type of organization whose members include students at any public or private institution of higher education.

273.title: Creating an offense for public intoxication due to drug use
273.description: The purpose of this bill is to create an offense for public intoxication due to drug use.

274.title: Relating to forgery and other crimes concerning lottery tickets
274.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that any sentence for violation of this statute be for a determinate period.

275.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
275.title: Relating to employees of the Commissioner of Agriculture
275.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Agriculture to employ a general counsel and any other such personnel necessary to perform the duties of the office. This bill is recommended by the Agriculture and Rural Development Committee for introduction and passage during the 2019 Regular Session of the Legislature.

276.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
276.title: Exempting social security benefits from state personal income tax
276.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax.

277.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
277.title: Relating to purchasing exemptions and procedures
277.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the handling of purchases by the Division of Corrections and Rehabilitation.

278.title: West Virginia Black Lung Program
278.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Black Lung Program and granting entitlement for pain and suffering for occupational pneumoconiosis.

279.title: Permitting directors of county emergency phone systems to obtain mobile-phone emergency lines
279.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend §24-6-5 by permitting the director of a county or municipality emergency telephone system to negotiate contracts for emergency mobile-phones in the county in the event landlines are unavailable.

280.title: Increasing the tax on the privilege of severing natural gas and oil
280.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the tax on the privilege of severing natural gas and oil from 5 percent to 7and one-half percent.

281.title: Authorizing local boards of health to assess, charge and collect increased environmental fees for restaurants
281.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize local boards of health to assess, charge and collect increased environmental fees for restaurants.

282.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
282.title: Creating a healthy living tax credit against the personal income tax
282.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a healthy living tax credit against the personal income tax.

283.title: Relating to compulsory school attendance
283.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the time, from 10 to five days the number of unexcused absences by a student, when a complaint may be made against a parent or guardian.

284.title: Requiring the State Board of Education to develop a method for funding student transportation costs as a stand-alone consideration
284.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Board of Education to propose a plan to fund school transportation costs as an item separate from the present total state basic foundation program, and providing for better consideration of fixed costs of transportation in counties with low-density population.

285.title: Relating to the intestate share of a decedent's surviving spouse
285.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the intestate share of a decedent's surviving spouse also includes all household goods, appliances and equipment, located at or generally associated with use of the last residence of the decedent if the spouse has been in cohabitation with the decedent in the previous 12 months prior to the death of the decedent. The bill makes an exception for items of sentimental value.

286.title: The Motion Picture Open Captioning Act
286.description: The purpose of this bill is to require exhibitors of motion pictures who operate two or more theatres in more than one location in this state to provide open captioning during at least two showings per week of each motion picture that is produced and offered with open captioning. The bill requires, when requested, audio description be provided for any motion picture that is produced and offered with audio description.

287.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
287.title: Banning plastic bags
287.description: The purpose of this bill is to ban plastic bags.

288.title: Relating to required notices for air quality permits prior to the permit being granted
288.description: The purpose of this bill is to require specific forms of notice to the public before an air quality permit may be issued.

289.title: Expanding the eligibility for service on county school boards
289.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the eligibility for service on county school boards to those running for or serving as a nonpartisan elected official of a class III or class IV municipality.

290.title: Requiring the issuance of a search warrant before a driver of a motor vehicle can be made to submit to a secondary blood test
290.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a search warrant be issued before a driver of a motor vehicle can be made to submit to a secondary blood test to determine the concentration of alcohol or controlled substance in his or her blood.

291.title: Relating to civil asset forfeiture
291.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the state to prove that the owner of seized property has been convicted of a crime and that the seized property was substantially related to said crime before the state can perfect title to seized property; and require that the state return seized property to its owner if the state cannot meet its evidentiary burden.

292.title: Collecting a user fee from oil and gas producers who use secondary roads in the state
292.description: The purpose of this bill is to collect a user fee from oil and gas producers who use secondary roads in the state. The bill provides for the distribution to the counties a proportional share of the collected fees.

294.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
294.title: Reinstating the film tax credits
294.description: The purpose of this bill is to reinstate the film tax credits removed by the Legislature in 2018 by the passage of Enrolled Senate Bill 263.

295.title: Providing that schools be closed for two weeks during the holiday season preceding Christmas Day and following New Year’s Day
295.description: The purpose of this bill is to is provide for school closings for two weeks during the holiday season preceding Christmas Day and following New Year’s Day.

296.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
296.title: Providing that the sale and purchase of copper as scrap metal may not be completed with the payment of cash
296.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the sale and purchase of copper as scrap metal may not be completed with the payment of cash, but by check paid to the seller at the address of the seller appearing on a valid driver's license or identification card issued by the West Virginia Division of Motor Vehicles, or any other valid photo identification of the seller issued by any other state or the federal government.

297.title: Relating to payment for the construction of any expanded or upgraded public service district facilities in certain circumstances
297.description: The purpose of this bill is to require new commercial and industrial customers to pay for the construction of any expanded or upgraded public service district facilities if the district’s present facilities are insufficient to serve the needs of that commercial or industrial consumer. The bill prohibits any costs being passed on to present consumers.

298.title: Repealing the soft drink tax
298.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the soft drink tax.

299.title: Freezing PEIA employee premiums for three years
299.description: The purpose of this bill is to freeze PEIA employee premiums for three years.

300.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
300.title: Establishing a tax credit for new businesses that locate in the state
300.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a tax credit for new businesses that locate in the state.Â The bill sets forth how the credit is determined.Â The bill establishes the conditions that must be met to qualify for the credit.Â The bill defines terms.

301.title: Authorizing insurance to married workers without children at reduced rates under the West Virginia Public Employees Insurance Act
301.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize insurance to married workers without children at reduced rates under the West Virginia Public Employees Insurance Act.

302.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
302.title: Allowing children in the custody of the state in any foster home, group home or other facility or residence to hunt and fish without a license
302.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow children in the custody of the state in any foster home, group home or other facility or residence to hunt and fish without a license.

303.title: Reducing state income taxes for state and federal retirees by increasing the exemption on retirement income
303.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce state income taxes for state and federal retirees by increasing the exemption on retirement income in calculating the federal gross income for state personal income tax purposes.

304.title: Requiring recipients of Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program be issued a photo identification card
304.description: Requiring recipients of Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program be issued a photo identification card

305.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
305.title: Exempting all veterans of the Armed Forces or any reserve component thereof from having to obtain a hunting, trapping fishing license
305.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt all veterans of the Armed Forces or any reserve component thereof from having to have hunting, trapping and fishing licenses.

306.last_action: To House Fire Departments and Emergency Medical Services
306.title: Providing programs to train firefighters and emergency medical technicians
306.description: The purpose of this bill is to require certain community and technical college or career and technical education centers to offer training for students to become firefighters or emergency medical technicians.

307.title: Relating to occupational pneumoconiosis claims
307.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that the time limitations provided for filing occupational pneumoconiosis claims in this section does not apply to or otherwise limit the ability of a claimant to obtain an evaluation from the Occupational Pneumoconiosis Board.

308.title: Relating to payment of taxes by co owner or others
308.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the payment of taxes by co owners or other interested parties.

309.title: Limiting the increase or decrease of state funding to a county board of education
309.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the increase or decrease of state school funding to any county to 2 percent of what the funding was the previous year.

310.title: Establishing the West Virginia Division of Natural Resources Police Officer Retirement System
310.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the West Virginia Division of Natural Resources Police Officer Retirement System.

311.title: Providing for a special “Don’t Tread On Me” license plate
311.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide authority for issuance of a special license plate saying “Don’t tread on me.”

312.title: Awarding service weapons to special natural resources police officers upon retirement
312.description: The purpose of this bill is to make stylistic changes.

313.title: Including possession of known stolen property in the offense of receiving or transferring stolen property
313.description: The purpose of this bill is to include possession of known stolen property in the offense of receiving or transferring stolen property.

314.title: Permitting service credit in the Teachers Retirement System to persons with alternative school teaching experience
314.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit service credit in the Teachers Retirement System to persons with alternative school teaching experience.

315.title: Relating to the regular election of officers on state general election day
315.description: The purpose of this bill is to place on the ballot of voters in every municipality of this state that does not hold municipal elections on the state general election day the question of whether the municipality shall hold its future municipal elections on a state general election day.

316.title: Requiring 30 minutes of unstructured play time daily for students in kindergarten through grade 5
316.description: The purpose of this bill is to require 30 minutes daily of unstructured play time for public school students in kindergarten through grade 5.

317.title: Creating a criminal felony offense of aggravated assault or battery of a child or a person who is mentally incapacitated
317.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a criminal felony offense of aggravated assault or battery of a child or a person who is mentally incapacitated.

318.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
318.title: Ensuring Patient Safety Act

319.title: Prohibiting the number of inquiries reflected in a credit report, credit score report or CLUE report from adversely affecting an application for insurance
319.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the use of a credit score to banking institution credit scoring for casualty insurance rate filings. The bill prohibits the use of credit scoring as a consideration in calculating insurance rates in homeowners or automobile liability policies. The bill prohibits the number of inquiries reflected in a credit report, credit score report or CLUE report from adversely affecting an application for insurance. The bill prohibits reliance on information which is false or potentially false. The bill limits the use of a credit score in casualty insurance rate filings.

320.title: Requiring the state board of education to develop an elective course on Vocational Agriculture
320.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Board of Education to develop an elective course on Vocational Agriculture.

321.title: Providing a maximum repair cost for insured owners of motor vehicles if a collision with a deer caused the damage
321.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit costs to insured automobile owners for repairs needed when they hit a deer on a state highway.

322.title: Modifying the contact requirements with a student’s guardians upon accrual of unexcused absences
322.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the contact requirements with a student’s guardians upon accrual of unexcused absences; specifying that a principal may make meaningful contact with guardians after a student has accrued three unexcused absences; and requiring meaningful contact be made with guardians after a student has accrued three and five unexcused absences.

323.title: Requiring the assessor of each county to, within three months of a deed filing in the county clerk's office of each county, prepare a new property tax ticket
323.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the assessor of each county to, within three months of a deed filing in the county clerk's office of each county, prepare a new property tax ticket and cause the tax ticket to be mailed, from the county sheriff's office, to the new property owner to avoid any lapse in which the new property owner may otherwise incur in paying property taxes.

324.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
324.title: Establishing reimbursement rates for congregate and in-home meals
324.description: The purpose of this bill is to raise the reimbursement rate for congregate and in- home meals.

325.title: Removing all costs and fees from a Silver Star registration plate
325.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove all fees for the initial issuance or renewal of a Silver Star registration plate.

326.title: Including volunteer firefighters within the Public Employees Insurance Act
326.description: The purpose of this bill is to include volunteer firefighters within the Public Employees Insurance Act and require the county commissions to pay either three-fourths or the full amount of premiums.

327.title: Ending tolls on the West Virginia Turnpike effective July 1, 2019
327.description: The purpose of this bill is to end tolls on the West Virginia Turnpike effective July 1, 2019.

328.title: Requiring each county school board to employ at least one full time school nurse
328.description: The purpose of this bill is to require county boards to employ at least one full time nurse for each public school.

329.title: Relating to qualifying children of state employees, receiving income of $25,000 per year or less, for the West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program
329.description: The purpose of this bill is to qualify children of state employees, receiving income of $25,000 per year or less, for the West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program.

331.title: Issuing a special registration plate for persons who are residents of this state and who have a family member diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder
331.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a special license plate for any person with a family member driver diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder.

332.title: Requiring school bus aides, who are trained in preventing bullying and providing a safe environment for students while being transported on a school bus, to be present on school buses
332.description: The purpose of this bill is to require school bus aides, who are trained to prevent bullying and to provide a safe environment for the students while being transported on a school bus, to be present on school buses.

333.last_action: To House Fire Departments and Emergency Medical Services
333.title: Exempting volunteer firefighters from fees for hunting, fishing and trapping licenses and permits
333.description: The purpose of this bill is to waive the fees for hunting, fishing and trapping licenses or permits for individuals who are currently serving as volunteer firefighters.

334.title: Making all inmates regardless of sex eligible to work on a state convict road force
334.description: The purpose of this bill is to make all state inmates regardless of sex members of the state convict road force.

335.title: Requiring owners of oil and gas wells to install and maintain separate meters that calculate the amount of production from those wells
335.description: The purpose of this bill is to require owners of oil and gas wells to install and maintain separate meters that calculate the amount of production from those well. The bill requires the Secretary of the Department of Environmental Protection to work with the State Tax Commissioner to implement procedures allowing the Office of Oil and Gas to verify production. The bill requires the information be shared with county assessors and royalty owners. The bill requires rule-making.

336.title: Clarifying what constitutes an action requiring service to the Attorney General and notice to the Legislature
336.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that actions that do not require monetary payments by a government agency, and other similar actions, do not mean “judgment” as defined in this article, and therefore do not require prior notice to the Legislature and Attorney General.

337.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
337.title: West Virginia Farm Fresh Raw Milk Act
337.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the West Virginia Farm Fresh Raw Milk Act. The bill authorizes the production and sale of raw milk by milk producers, requires producers to use best sanitary milking and milk handling practices, and establishes sanitary and other requirements for production and sales.

338.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
338.title: Allowing an owner of Japanese quail to keep them as pets without having to obtain a license
338.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow an owner of Japanese quail (Coturnix Quail and Button Quail) to keep them as pets without having to obtain a license for a private game farm.

339.title: Relating to power of security guards to arrest individuals
339.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide arrest authority for security guards on the property the guard is employed to protect.

340.title: Providing a safe harbor for employers to correct underpayment or nonpayment of wages and benefits due to separated employees
340.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a safe harbor for employers to correct underpayment or nonpayment of wages and benefits due to separated employees prior to the filing of a lawsuit. The bill prohibits an employee from seeking liquidated damages or attorney’s fees when bringing an action for the underpayment or nonpayment of wages and benefits due upon the employee’s separation of employment without first making a written demand top that employer. The bill permits only those employees who have made a written demand on the employer to be included in a class action brought for the underpayment or nonpayment of wages and benefits due upon the employee’s separation of employment. The bill defines the term “written demand”.

341.title: Providing state health care services for all active and inactive duty military personnel
341.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide state health care services for all active and inactive duty military personnel.

343.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
343.title: Relating to public health

344.title: Creating a presidential service registration plate
344.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the issuance of a special registration plate for recipients of the federal Presidential Service Badge.

345.title: Health Care Choice Act
345.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Health Care Choice Act authorizing insurers from other states to engage in the business of health insurance in West Virginia with the written approval of the Insurance Commissioner and subject to qualifications and other requirements determined by the Insurance Commissioner.

346.title: Establishing a tax on the production of natural gas to fund the public employees insurance program
346.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a new fee on each MFC of natural gas produced to fully fund PEIA benefits at current levels; allow a tax credit for value added jobs in West Virginia for persons paying this fee; and creating a special reserve account to assume that sufficient moneys are collected to preserve the existing insurance program for a 5-year period, then allowing excess proceeds to be directed to general revenue.

347.title: Relating to the manner in which actual investment of capital and costs and a natural gas utility’s expedited cost recovery are calculated
347.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the manner in which actual investment of capital and costs and a natural gas utility’s expedited cost recovery are calculated and determined by the Public Service Commission.

348.title: Exempting buildings or structures utilized exclusively for agricultural purposes from the provisions of the State Building Code
348.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt buildings or structures utilized exclusively for agricultural purposes from the provisions of the State Building Code which may be adopted by any county or municipality.

349.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
349.title: The West Virginia Refugee Absorptive Capacity Act
349.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Refugee Absorptive Capacity Act. The bill provides a short title. The bill defines terms. The bill sets forth the duties of the state office within the Department of Health and Human Resources that deals with refugees. The bill permits moratorium applications and cessations. The bill requires a fiscal impact assessment. The bill requires reports. The bill requires the Department of Health and Human Resources to administer the West Virginia Refugee Resettlement Program Plan. The bill provides a severability provision.

350.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
350.title: West Virginia Child Advocate for the Protection of Children Act
350.description: The purpose of this bill is to add language to West Virginia Code to provide a child advocate for the protection of children.

351.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
351.title: Exempting honorably discharged veterans of the from payment of fees and costs for a license to carry deadly weapons
351.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt honorably discharged veterans of the Armed Forces of the United States from payment of fees and costs required by this section for a license to carry deadly weapons. This exemption already applies to former law-enforcement officers who are honorably retired.

352.title: Eliminating the personal property tax on new vehicles
352.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the personal property tax on new vehicles purchased by and registered to a resident of this state.

353.title: Relating to state issued identification cards
353.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the issuance of a state issued identification card without a photo on the card, based upon certification that taking a photograph would violate religion tenet or religious belief.

354.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
354.title: Providing guidance for prosecuting attorneys in cases involving abused and neglected children
354.description: The purpose of this bill is to add language to the West Virginia Code to provide guidance for prosecuting attorneys in cases involving abused and neglected children and a means of resolving conflicts with representatives of the DHHR.

355.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
355.title: Establishing a bill of rights for foster parents
355.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a bill of rights for foster parents.

356.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
356.title: Establishing a bill of rights of children in foster care
356.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a bill of rights for children in foster care.

357.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
357.title: Refugee Information Act
357.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Refugee Information Act.

358.title: Relating to replacing the present crime of burglary with the crime of home invasion
358.description: The purpose of this bill is to replace the present crime of burglary with the crime of home invasion. This bill provides for the criminal offenses of home invasion in the first, second, third and fourth degrees. The bill prescribes penalties.

359.title: Creating an additional index system for state-owned lands
359.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a naming convention to records lands owned by the state in an index system for easy cross-reference to county indexes.

360.title: Redistricting of the Senate into 16 two-member senatorial districts and redistricting the House into 96 single member districts
360.description: The purpose of this bill is to create 16 two-member senatorial districts and 96Â single-member delegate districts based on the 2010 census and implemented during the 2020 elections.

361.title: Prohibiting manufacturing plants from locating within two air miles of an existing public school
361.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit manufacturing plants from locating within two air miles of an existing public school without the written permission of the county school board.Â The bill also requires that that a majority of the school board voted to grant this permission.

362.title: Requiring public hearing for applicant for air quality permit relating to facility of certain investment value
362.description: The purpose of this bill is to require public hearings on air quality permits for large facilities, in the county where the facility is to be located.

363.title: Relating to death penalty for first degree murder
363.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a death penalty and procedures and standards applicable thereto, and automatic review of the penalty, for commission of murder in the first degree.Â Procedures for carrying out the death sentence are established.

364.title: Expunging records of unsubstantiated complaints made by the Department of Health and Human Resources against teachers
364.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove from the permanent records of school employees and the Department of Health and Human Resources, documentation regarding unsubstantiated complaints filed against the employee that the school board took no action upon.

365.title: Establishing an optional bus operator in residence program for school districts
365.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a Bus Operator in Residence program to assist school districts with inadequate substitute bus operator pools.

366.title: Requiring the use of statutory income tax rates for ratemaking purposes for certain public utilities
366.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that state and federal income tax rates are to be used for ratemaking purposes for public utilities that are part of a publicly-traded, consolidated group.

367.title: Placing penalty points on driver’s licenses for using electronic communications devices while operating a motor vehicle
367.description: The purpose of this bill is to place penalty points on driver’s licenses for using electronic communications devices while operating a motor vehicle.

368.title: Small Business Tax Credit
368.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a temporary tax credit for small group employers to cover a tax credit of up to 50 percent of the costs of branding, marketing and advertising of agricultural or manufactured products produced or manufactured in West Virginia. The bill establishes limits. The bill provides that the credit be available for five years. These sections have been completely rewritten; therefore, they have been completely underscored.

369.title: Relating to preventing compensatory damage awards for medical expenses from including certain sums
369.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent compensatory damage awards for medical expenses from including sums that the claimant has not and will not pay for medical care or treatment.

370.title: Recognition of Emergency Medical Services Personnel Licensure Interstate Compact
370.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Recognition of Emergency Medical Services Personnel Licensure Interstate Compact. The bill enters the state into the Compact with all jurisdictions that also enact the compact.

371.title: Defend the Guard Act
371.description: The purpose of this bill is to require an official declaration of war or an action to call forth the state militia by the United States Congress before members of the West Virginia National Guard may be released from state control to participate in active duty combat.

372.title: Adding “sexual orientation” and “gender identity” to the categories covered by the Human Rights Act
372.description: The purpose of this bill is to add “sexual orientation” and “gender identity” to the categories covered by the Human Rights Act, prohibiting discrimination in employment and places of public accommodation. The bill adds “age”, “sexual orientation” and “gender identity” to the categories covered by the Fair Housing Act prohibiting discrimination in housing. The bill defines “sexual orientation” and “gender identity”.

373.title: Relating to state road construction
373.description: The purpose of this bill is to require any state road or bridge that exceeds 55 miles per hour that is under construction for longer than 72 hours proceed with work 24 hours per day until completed, weather permitting.

374.last_action: Motion to take discharge motion from table rejected (Roll No. 228)
374.title: Relating to unlawful discriminatory practices in categories covered by the Human Rights Act and the Fair Housing Act
374.description: The purpose of this bill is to add “sexual orientation” and “gender identity” to the categories covered by the Human Rights Act, prohibiting discrimination in employment and places of public accommodation. The bill adds “age”, “sexual orientation” and “gender identity” to the categories covered by the Fair Housing Act prohibiting discrimination in housing. The bill defines “sexual orientation” and “gender identity”.

375.title: Making available elective courses on the history of the Old and New Testaments of the Bible
375.description: The purpose of this bill is to make available elective courses of instruction in all schools located within this state on the history of the Old and New Testaments of the Bible.

376.title: Allowing parents or the school to serve sweets during the holidays if the school receives parental or guardian consent
376.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow parents or the school to serve sweets during the holidays if the school receives parental or guardian consent.

377.title: Increasing the amount of retirement income to be excluded from the gross income of individuals receiving retirement benefits under the West Virginia Public Employees Retirement System
377.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase from $2,000 to $20,000 the amount of retirement income to be excluded from the gross income of individuals receiving retirement benefits under the West Virginia Public Employees Retirement System and the West Virginia State Teachers Retirement System, except those state retirees receiving any federal retirement benefit. The bill also provides an effective date.

378.title: Relating to quarterly payment of real and personal property taxes
378.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow quarterly payment of real and personal property taxes and to require new tax tickets to be mailed after property is transferred.

379.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
379.title: Adding to the persons who have access to the information kept by the Board of Pharmacy
379.description: The purpose of this bill is to add to the persons who have access to the information kept by the Board of Pharmacy.

380.title: Permitting stand-in candidates for gubernatorial and presidential contests
380.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit stand-in candidates for gubernatorial and presidential contests.

381.title: Establishing certain requirements for dental insurance
381.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish certain requirements for dental insurance.

382.title: Requiring contractors performing work for government contracts on computers use software to verify the hours
382.description: The purpose of this bill is to require contractors using computers to complete government contracts have software that verifies the amount of hours worked on the computer or computers for the contract.

383.title: Authorizing the Governor to seek the return of fugitives
383.description: The purpose of this bill is to update provisions authorizing the Governor to seek the return of fugitives who have been convicted of a crime, have violated bail, probation, or parole, or have been improperly released from confinement when those persons flee to another state or to the District of Columbia.

384.title: Establishing minimum numbers of school counselors
384.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a minimum number of school counselors that shall be employed by the county board and assigned to each high, middle, and elementary school in the state.

385.title: Modernizing rental car transactions
385.description: The purpose of this bill is to modernize rental car interactions. The bill permits daily passenger rental car companies to collect reasonable administrative fees incidental to, or arising from, the rental transaction when the administrative fees are expressly authorized by the master agreement and acknowledged by the customer. The legislation permits digital and electronic rentals and provides that a rental car provider has met certain obligations when the renter has not executed a rental agreement or interacts with an employee of the provider. The bill permits motor vehicle rentals by private vehicle rental program providers under certain circumstances. The bill also defines terms and provides that all person engaging in rental car transactions including private vehicle rental program providers are subject the provisions contained in this chapter.

387.title: Relating to the financial responsibility of inmates in relation to civil awards
387.description: The purpose of this bill is to include civil settlements in moneys that should be paid on court ordered obligations of inmates, and allowing the division to subtract the moneys from civil judgments and settlements to be paid towards court ordered obligations even if a court of competent jurisdiction does not enter an order.

388.title: Allowing firearms-qualified tax division investigators to carry firearms
388.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow firearms-qualified tax division investigators to carry firearms.

389.title: Relating to a student not advancing to the next grade by teacher recommendation
389.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that parents cannot overrule a teacher’s recommendation that a student not be advanced to the next grade unless the student is retested over summer break and can demonstrate proficiency in areas for which the teacher recommended the that the student not be advanced.

390.title: Citizen and State Accountability Act
390.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Governor’s consent to accept certain grants.

391.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
391.title: Relating to the right to farm
391.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect the right to farm and protect agricultural operations from nuisance litigation if the facility has been in operation for more than one year.

392.last_action: Removed from calendar by Rules Committee
392.title: Requiring each high school student to complete a full credit course of study in personal finance
392.description: The purpose of this bill is to require each high school student to complete a one- half credit course of study in personal finance as a requirement for high school graduation.

393.title: Providing one-time supplements to all annuitants when they reach the age of seventy
393.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a supplement of three percent to be paid to all annuitants of the Public Employees Retirement and Teachers Retirement Systems at the time they reach the age of 70.

394.title: Providing that school nutrition plans include take home meals for low income students
394.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that school nutrition plans include take home meals for low income students or any student who requests take home meals.

395.title: Extending the expiration of driver's licenses for active military members' spouses
395.description: Extending the expiration of driver's licenses for active military members' spouses

396.title: Reopening period to allow purchase of State Teachers Retirement System service credit following transfer
396.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow purchase of Teachers Retirement System service credit by transfer from Teachers Defined Contribution System.

397.title: Establishing the Summer Feeding for All initiative
397.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Summer Feeding for All initiative that will encourage county school systems to look for innovative ways to provide assistance to students in need to access nutritious foods during summer break and other times when school is not is session; requiring each county school board to conduct an assessment of the availability of food to students to determine what food insecurities exist in the student population; directing each county school board compile and distribute a list of existing food providers in the community that will provide nutritious food to children with food insecurities on nonschool days; and directing the Office of Child Nutrition to help facilitate county school boards coordinate and develop the public policy initiative of Feed to Achieve.

398.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
398.title: Relating to analysis of samples of industrial hemp production
398.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the Commissioner of Agriculture to contract with local laboratories to analyze samples from industrial hemp farms to ensure that the plants do not have unlawful levels of tetrahydrocannabinol.

399.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
399.title: Relating to modification reducing federal adjusted gross income for social security benefits
399.description: The purpose of this bill is to subtract social security benefits from federal adjusted gross income to the extent included in federal gross income for federal income tax purposes.

401.title: Requiring local entities to enforce immigration laws
401.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all local entities of this state to enforce immigration laws. The bill provides for a complaint procedure and notice provided to the entity out of compliance with this article. The bill establishes actions to be taken against a local entity if the entity does not come into compliance within 90 days of receiving notice. The bill permits the denial of funds resulting from any final judicial determination a local entity violated this article. The bill establishes rule-making authority with the State Auditor in regard to the denial of state funds.

402.title: Modifying the method of calculation of the employer and employee contribution percentages for public employee insurance premiums
402.description: The purpose of this bill is to effectuate the recommendations of the Governors Task Force on PEIA recommendation on altering the method of calculation of the 80-20 employer/employee match that is required under current law for calculation of payments for PEIA premiums.Â

403.title: Allowing the Office of Miners' Health, Safety and Training to inspect the records of employers of certified persons for compliance purposes
403.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Office of Miners' Health, Safety and Training to an inspect records of employers of certified persons for compliance purposes, including, but not limited to, compliance with requirements relating to training and drug screenings.

404.title: Making it a felony to transport certain drugs into the state with intent to deliver
404.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a felony to transport certain drugs into the state with intent to deliver. The bill prescribes criminal penalties. The bill makes an exception.

405.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
405.title: Youth Mental Health Protection Act
405.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender youth from conversion therapy, also known as sexual orientation change efforts or reparative therapy. The bill makes legislative findings and sets forth a purpose. The bill defines terms. The bill sets forth a prohibition for referral services for conversion therapy. The bill provides for disciplinary actions against certain persons violating the prohibitions.

406.title: Reopening period to allow purchase of State Teachers Retirement System service credit by transfer
406.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow purchase of Teachers Retirement System service credit by transfer from Teachers Defined Contribution System.

407.title: Relating to criminal penalties for reckless driving
407.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties associated with reckless driving resulting in death or serious bodily injury.

408.title: Creating an enhanced penalty for certain aggravated serious traffic offenses
408.description: The purpose of this bill is to create an enhanced penalty for persons convicted of DUI or reckless driving when the conduct creates a severe and imminent danger to one or more minors outside the vehicle.

409.title: Relating to teacher to pupil ratio in grades first through third
409.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the teacher-pupil ratio for first through third grade at no more than 1 to 20, and to provide that third-grade students must demonstrate proficiency before advancing to fourth grade.

410.title: Requiring drug testing companies to have contractor IDs and mandatory safety training before performing work on mine property
410.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all drug testing companies to have contractor IDs and mandatory safety training before being allowed to perform work on mine property.

411.title: Changing provisions regarding polygraph examinations of sex offenders
411.description: The purpose of this bill is to change provisions regarding polygraph examinations of sex offenders.

412.title: Providing a special license plate for spay and neuter advocates
412.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a special license plate for spay and neuter advocates. The bill also sets a fee.

413.title: Allowing a county commission in certain counties to impose an amusement tax to support medical care
413.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a county commission in certain counties to impose an amusement tax to support medical care and emergency services in the county.

414.title: Increasing the amount that a faculty senate of a public school may allocate to a classroom teacher or librarian for academic materials
414.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount that a faculty senate may allocate to a classroom teacher or librarian for academic materials, supplies or equipment which, in the judgment of the teacher or librarian, will assist providing instruction.

415.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
415.title: Relating to exemptions from mandated immunizations
415.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide exemptions from mandatory immunizations.

416.title: Providing a special license plate to support adoption
416.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the issuance of a special license plate to support adoption.

417.title: Increasing the expenditure for academic materials, supplies, and equipment
417.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the expenditure for academic materials, supplies, and equipment from $200 to $300.

418.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
418.title: Permitting the taking of bait fish with a net not exceeding 12 foot in radius
418.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the use of a net, not exceeding 12 feet in radius, to take bait fish.

419.title: Authorizing certain teachers to use alternative teaching programs
419.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit classroom teachers to choose different teaching programs if students being taught under an agency-approved teaching program are not producing acceptable test scores.

420.title: Relating to mandatory drug testing of all classes of employees in K through 12 schools
420.description: The purpose of this bill is to require drug testing of all classes of employees in K through 12 schools.

421.title: Relating to the Underwood-Smith scholarship and loan assistance program and teacher scholarship and loan program
421.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the purpose of the scholarship beginning in 2020; establish scholarship preference for applicants pursuing math and science teaching careers; modify selection criteria for the award of scholarships; modify scholarship agreement condition requirements; modify scholarship renewal requirements; modify purpose of teacher scholarship program to those pursuing careers in teaching math or science; modify scholarship agreement condition requirements for teachers; and modify scholarship renewal requirements for teachers.

422.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
422.title: Establishing an advisory council on rare diseases
422.description: The purpose of this bill is to create an advisory council to educate the public and the medical community in the recognition, diagnosis, treatment and research of rare diseases.

423.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
423.title: West Virginia Healthy Food Crop Block Grant Program
423.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the West Virginia Healthy Food Crop Block Grant Program. The program will provide an incentive of up to $10,000 per year to eligible West Virginia farmers who commit to growing fruits and vegetables that serve community health initiatives. Produce from the healthy food crop block grants will be managed in real-time within a statewide inventory system administered by a food and farm nonprofit organization and delivered straight to hospitals, senior food services, “farmacies”, kid's markets, nutrition programs, and neighborhood wellness programs to name a few.

424.title: Reducing the number of students and schools that a school nurse must serve
424.description: The purpose of this bill is to make school nurses more available to students by reducing the nurse to student ratio and nurse to school ratio.

425.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
425.title: Increasing the state minimum wage
425.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the minimum wage in West Virginia every year to $12.00 an hour by 2022.

426.title: Establishing an insurance program for health and medical insurance coverage to be offered in counties with limited insurance providers
426.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Insurance Commissioner to establish an insurance program for health and medical insurance coverage to be offered in counties with limited insurance providers.

427.title: Relating to the commission allowed to a sheriff for collection of taxes
427.description: The purpose of this bill is to include the statutory commission paid to a high-performing sheriff within the calculations for incremental increases or other raises to the pay for a county sheriff.

428.title: Relating to charging a fee for parking in an accessible parking space bearing the international symbol of access
428.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit public entities, including state, county and municipal buildings and facilities, places of public accommodation and commercial facilities, from charging a fee for parking in an accessible parking space bearing the international symbol of access.

429.title: Altering the color scheme for county vehicle registration plates
429.description: The purpose of this bill is to alter the color scheme for county vehicle registration plates; alter the color scheme for city or municipality vehicle registration plates; provide that all county vehicle registration plates, title certificates, and registration certificates shall expire on December 31, 2019; provide for exemptions for certain county Class A license plates; require all counties to obtain a new title certificate, registration certificate, and registration plate for all county vehicles prior to January 1, 2020; require renewal every two years; provide that all city and municipal registration plates, title certificates, and registration certificates shall expire on December 31, 2019; provide for exemptions for certain city and municipal Class A license plates; require all cities or municipalities to obtain a new title certificate, registration certificate, and registration plate for all city or municipality vehicles prior to January 1, 2020; and require renewal every two years.

430.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
430.title: Expanding the definitions of locations where enhanced penalties for selling controlled substances to a minor are applicable
430.description: The purpose of this bill is to include additional locations where enhance penalties for selling controlled substances to a minor are applicable.

431.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
431.title: Establishing a West Virginia business growth in low-income communities tax credit
431.description: style='color:windowtext'>The purpose of this bill is to establish a West Virginia business growth in low-income communities tax credit.

432.title: Allowing the Executive Director of the West Virginia Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority to establish a work program
432.description: The purpose of this bill is to define who is a qualified inmate for work program and provide good time credit for regional jail inmates participating in a work program.

433.title: Including digital and virtual information in the definition of property that can be searched and seized by a warrant
433.description: The purpose of this bill is to include digital and virtual information in the definition of property that can be searched and seized by a warrant.

434.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
434.title: Increasing minimum salaries for Bureau for Child Support Enforcement attorneys
434.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the minimum salaries for child support enforcement attorneys from $45,000 to $75,000 per year.

435.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
435.title: Establishing a program to monitor and regulate dangerous pharmaceutical distribution practices
435.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a mechanism to prevent the excessive distribution of dangerous prescription drugs in the state; providing for the state pharmacy board and the attorney general to monitor sales of these drugs and the board to restrict excessive sales, establishing reporting requirements for pharmaceutical distributors, granting authority under the consumer credit and protection act for the Attorney General to monitor and enforce distribution of dangerous drugs in the state; and requiring that the Attorney General to gain approval from the Legislature for any drug settlements.

436.title: Relating to driving restrictions in school zones
436.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure the safety of students participating in school activities outside of regular school hours by requiring activation of school zone flashing beacons whenever students are present at school for activities occurring outside of a school’s regular hours of operation.

437.title: Relating to billing practices of public utilities
437.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit public utilities from estimating customers’ utility bills.

438.title: Creating the West Virginia Intrastate Commerce Improvement Act
438.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Intrastate Commerce Improvement Act ensuring that businesses, organizations and employers doing business in West Virginia are subject to uniform nondiscrimination laws and obligations.

439.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
439.title: Relating to wages of persons with disabilities
439.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for fair pay and maximized employment of disabled persons; create a state “Employment First” policy that encourages agencies to facilitate employment of disabled persons; establish a task force to initiate these policies; provide for the DHHR Bureau for Behavioral Health, Division of Rehabilitation Services, Department of Education, DHHR Bureau for Medical Services (State Medicaid Agency) and Workforce WV to implement the policy; and remove current exemption for paying minimum wages to persons in nonprofit workshops.

440.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
440.title: Fetal Heartbeat Act
440.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Fetal Heartbeat Act. The bill prohibits abortions when a fetal heartbeat is detected. The bill provides exceptions. The bill makes findings. The bill establishes standards, requirements, and procedures. The bill requires documentation. The bill requires notice and acknowledgments. The bill creates the Joint Legislative Committee on Adoption Promotion and Support. The bill establishes penalties. The bill permits civil actions. The bill defines terms. The bill provides for rule-making.

441.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
441.title: Implementing drug testing for legislators of the State of West Virginia
441.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a drug testing program for legislators who shall be required to submit to drug testing.Â Â Any legislator who fails two consecutive drug tests must forfeit all pay and allowances. The bill also ensures confidentiality of records.

442.title: Permitting third party ownership of on-site renewable and alternative generating facilities
